title: When I print web page content using Firefox, the content of checkboxes and buttons is lost.
content:
Due to the lack of a suitable topic related to “print” options, I can only choose the topic related to persistence, "Download and Save."

The first image is part of the original webpage, where one of the buttons is selected.

However, in the print view (the second image), the selected state disappears.

I have switched across multiple devices, various versions of Firefox, and several different printers (MS Print to PDF or physical printers), and this phenomenon consistently occurs.

Firefox is my daily browser, but in order to print similar financial approval forms, I have to switch to Edge or Chrome to complete the task.

I hope Mozilla's excellent engineers can locate and fix this issue.

Thank you.

title: Access to RT information
content: A friend in Canada has sent me a link to an RT (Russia Today) posting which reflects badly on Israel. I know the MSM in "the West" seek to suppress information which does not reflect well on Israel, but I am entitled to see — and form my own opinion about — information from any source. I don't think that my access to information should be prevented by Big Brother deciding what I may and may not see. Why is my access to information being frustrated? On whose authority? The people being criticised in the report I want to see? WHO is considering this question? What legal (U.K.) authority or entitlement do they have to frustrate my wish to view information. This really is Big Brother creepy stuff.

title: Question regarding removal of “Never” in “Override the colors specified” setting
content:
Hello,

I have noticed that in Firefox settings, the option “Override the colors specified” with the choice “Never” has disappeared.

This option was very useful to me for testing web accessibility. Indeed, by modifying the default colors and selecting “Override the colors specified” with the “Never” option, I was able to force Firefox to display the colors specified by the page author while still highlighting the default colors (those not specified by the author).

Could you please let me know why this setting was removed? Is there an alternative or another way to achieve the same behavior in Firefox today?

Thank you in advance for your help.

title: Bookmarks are gone, can't add more

title: Email Accounts Requiring Sign-In
content: I have three email accounts thru (comcast, gmail and outlook). I have each of these email accounts bookmarked on my Firefox page. It used to be all I had to do was click on the bookmarked tab and the email account opened immediately. But, lately, each of these three accounts requires a sign-in before it will open my email account. One even requires a two-step process requiring I list a different email to receive a code to open the current email account I'm trying to open. This is a recent occurence and I wondered if it was something Firefox included in their more recent version of Firefox? If so, please tell me how to get rid of this sign-in process! I have many security processes to protect my accounts and do not need this additional required sign-in process! Please tell me how I can get rid of this requirement. It is a pain to have to re-sign-in each time I try to access my email which I do several times a day. Thank you for any help you can give me to fix this problem. Barbara Thomas
